definitions.definition: One rejected by God; a sinful person.
An individual with low morals or principles.
Rejected; cast off as worthless.
Rejected by God; damned, sinful.
Immoral, having no religious or principled character.
definitions.example: The reprobate criminal sneered at me.

definitions.definition: To have strong disapproval of something; to reprove; to condemn.
Of God: to abandon or reject, to deny eternal bliss.
To refuse, set aside.
To take away the leaden seals from (the bales of transit goods).
To take out the leads from (printed matter that has been set up).
An unleaded fuel.
Decaffeinated coffee.
Low-alcohol beer.
Without lead.
(of gasoline) Containing no more than 0.05 grams of lead per gallon.
(of coffee) Decaffeinated.
(of beer) Having low alcohol content.
An ornamental plume on a helmet.
Flamboyance, energetic style or action; dash; verve.
A long, angry or violent speech; a diatribe.
A section of verse concerning a single theme; a laisse.
To make a long, angry or violent speech, a tirade.
A medical doctor specializing in the eye: deficiencies of vision requiring correction, and diseases. Compare optometrist.
A light sword, sharp along the front edge, part of the back edge, and at the point.
A modern fencing sword modeled after the sabre.
To strike or kill with a sabre.
A person who tunes a piano or organ.
A device, electronic or mechanical, that helps a person tune a musical instrument by showing the deviation of the played pitch from the desired pitch.
On a musical instrument, a peg or mechanical device that changes the tension, and hence pitch, of a string.
The component of an audio system that receives radio broadcasts.
One who sings or makes music.
(entertainment industry) A musical.
The speaker or writer, referred to as the grammatical subject, of a sentence.
The speaker or writer, referred to as the grammatical object, of a sentence.
definitions.example: Mom drove my sister and I to school.

definitions.definition: An instance of the interjection ah.
definitions.example: the crowd's oohs and ahs at the fireworks

definitions.definition: To give a cry of "ah".
An expression of relief, relaxation, comfort, confusion, understanding, wonder, awe, etc. according to uttered inflection.
definitions.example: Ah! It's good to be back home!

definitions.definition: A syllable used to fill space, particularly in music.
An addition, an extension.
An appendix to a book or document.
An addition or extension to a building.
An addition to the territory of a country or state, from a neighbouring country or state, normally by military force.
To add something to another thing, especially territory; to incorporate.
definitions.example: The ancient city of Petra was annexed by Rome.

definitions.definition: To attach or connect, as a consequence, condition, etc.
definitions.example: to annex a penalty to a prohibition, or punishment to guilt

definitions.definition: To join; to be united.
A deep, rumbling, threatening sound made in the throat by an animal.
(by extension) The rumbling sound made by a person's stomach when hungry.
(by extension) An aggressive grumbling.
(by extension) A low-pitched rumbling sound produced with a wind instrument.
To utter a deep guttural sound, as an angry animal; to give forth an angry, grumbling sound.
definitions.example: The dog growled at me as I walked past.

definitions.definition: Of a wind instrument: to produce a low-pitched rumbling sound.
To send a user a message via the Growl software library.
To express (something) by growling.
definitions.example: The old man growled his displeasure at the postman.

definitions.definition: To play a wind instrument in a way that produces a low-pitched rumbling sound.
A downward trend, or the beginnings of one; a decline.
definitions.example: The downturn in the economy made it harder to find jobs.

definitions.definition: To turn downwards
To decline
Any bird of the family Dicruridae.
A fool, an idiot, a stupid fellow.
A group of people who have a different ethnicity, religion, language or culture from that of the majority of people in the place where they live.
In ice hockey and lacrosse, a player position with a primary responsibility to prevent the opposing team from scoring goals; same as defender in many other ballgames.

The green, unripe, form of the sweet bell pepper. Popular in cooking, especially Italian cuisine. The unripe bell pepper is green and generally changes to other colors as it matures, cultivars exist for red, orange, yellow and other shades.
A green variety of dried peppercorn, made from the unripe berries by treating them in a manner that retains the green colour.
A Mexican alcoholic drink distilled from the fermented juice of the agave.
The peyote cactus.
A line (of seaweed or differently coloured sand etc) on the shore showing the level of high or low tide
(by extension) any mark showing the limit of some past activity
A line of scum left on a bath tub when the water is drained away
Bad, unkind or abusive treatment
A small, orange citrus-like fruit which is native to Asia (Citrus japonica, syn. Fortunella japonica).
A fixation with healthy or righteous eating
A favorably disposed attitude toward someone or something.
The value of a business entity not directly attributable to its tangible assets and liabilities. This value derives from factors such as consumer loyalty to the brand.

A concept used to refer to the ability of an individual or business to exert influence within a community, club, market or another type of group, without having to resort to the use of an asset (such as money or property), either directly or by the creation of a lien.
To lose strength and become weak; to be in a state of weakness or sickness.
To pine away in longing for something; to have low spirits, especially from lovesickness.
definitions.example: He languished without his girlfriend

definitions.definition: To live in miserable or disheartening conditions.
definitions.example: He languished in prison for years

definitions.definition: To be neglected; to make little progress, be unsuccessful.
definitions.example: The case languished for years before coming to trial.

definitions.definition: To make weak; to weaken, devastate.
To affect a languid air, especially disingenuously.
A radio wave of over 1 kilometre in length, having a frequency less than 300 kHz.
To administer anesthesia to: to render unfeeling or unconscious through the use of narcotic substances, usually either alcohol or pharmaceutical drugs.
definitions.example: Just prior to surgery the doctor will anesthetize him and he will sleep for four hours.

definitions.definition: (usually postpositive) That is in an adjacent place; that is located next door.
definitions.example: Try the place next door.

definitions.definition: In an adjacent building, room or place.
Next door to.
To execute (somebody) without a proper legal trial or procedure, especially by hanging and backed by a mob.
A ledge, a terrace; a right-angled projection; a lynchet.
An acclivity; a small hill or hillock.
A four-base hit.
definitions.example: The first baseman hit a home run to lead off the ninth.

definitions.definition: The portion of a journey that ends at home.
definitions.example: I'm on the home run.

definitions.definition: A success; especially, a popular success.
definitions.example: The product was a home run.

definitions.definition: Sexual intercourse.
A locking system in vehicles, where locks to all the doors can be locked or unlocked in a single operation.
A survey of people, usually statistically analyzed to gauge wider public opinion.
A formal election.
definitions.example: The student council had a poll to see what people want served in the cafeteria.

definitions.definition: A polling place (usually as plural, polling places)
definitions.example: The polls close at 8 p.m.

definitions.definition: (now rare outside veterinary medicine contexts) The head, particularly the scalp or pate upon which hair (normally) grows.
(in extended senses of the above) A mass of people, a mob or muster, considered as a head count.
The broad or butt end of an axe or a hammer.
The pollard or European chub, a kind of fish.
A pet parrot.
(Cambridge University) One who does not try for honors at university, but is content to take a degree merely; a passman.
The fine particles which are the result of reducing dry substance by pounding, grinding, or triturating, or the result of decay; dust.
A mixture of fine dry, sweet-smelling particles applied to the face or other body parts, to reduce shine or to alleviate chaffing.
An explosive mixture used in gunnery, blasting, etc.; gunpowder.
A very pale blue colour.
Freshly fallen, uncompacted snow, especially in the context of Alpine skiing
definitions.example: Expert skiers love skiing on powder snow.

definitions.definition: Any system of pipes or tubes; piping
The pipes and stops of an organ
A close race or contest in which no winner is apparent
definitions.example: Polls indicated a dead heat for the office of dog catcher.

definitions.definition: The scientific study of nerve and brain function in people and animals.
To build or complete.
To assemble, prepare.
To arrange or advance.
An immature stage in the life cycle of an insect; a larva.
Food.
A short, thick man; a dwarf.
A dirty person.
A despicable person; a lowlife.
To scavenge or in some way scrounge, typically for food.
To dig; to dig up by the roots; to root out by digging; often followed by up.
definitions.example: to grub up trees, rushes, or sedge

definitions.definition: To supply with food.
To eat.
A female ballet dancer
The star female ballet performer in the company
(sometimes derogatory) a male ballet dancer
A ballet flat shoe
Of a person, displaying or possessing courage.
definitions.example: the most courageous person I have ever met

definitions.definition: Of an action, that requires courage.
definitions.example: a courageous deed

definitions.definition: (with person as subject) To cook (something) in an oven.
definitions.example: I baked a delicious cherry pie.

definitions.definition: (with baked thing as subject) To be cooked in an oven.
definitions.example: The cake baked at 350°F.

definitions.definition: To be warmed to drying and hardening.
definitions.example: The clay baked in the sun.

definitions.definition: To dry by heat.
definitions.example: They baked the electrical parts lightly to remove moisture.

definitions.definition: To be hot.
definitions.example: I'm baking after that workout in the gym.

definitions.definition: To cause to be hot.
To smoke marijuana.
To harden by cold.
To fix (lighting, reflections, etc.) as part of the texture of an object to improve rendering performance.
(with "in" or "into") To incorporate into something greater.
An action in which something is baked.
definitions.example: I'm going to do some baking this afternoon.

definitions.definition: The way in which something is baked.
The production of a batch of baked product.
That bakes.
definitions.example: baking bread   baking clay

definitions.definition: Of a person, an object, or the weather: very hot; boiling, broiling, roasting.
definitions.example: I'm baking – could you open the window?

definitions.definition: A system for computation using letters or other symbols to represent numbers, with rules for manipulating these symbols.
The surgical treatment of a dislocated or fractured bone. Also : a dislocation or fracture.
The study of algebraic structures.
A universal algebra.

An algebraic structure consisting of a module over a commutative ring (or a vector space over a field) along with an additional binary operation that is bilinear over module (or vector) addition and scalar multiplication.

A collection of subsets of a given set, such that this collection contains the empty set, and the collection is closed under unions and complements (and thereby also under intersections and differences).
One of several other types of mathematical structure.
A system or process, that is like algebra by substituting one thing for another, or in using signs, symbols, etc., to represent concepts or ideas.
A passage in text that is about a different subject from the preceding text, marked by commencing on a new line, the first line sometimes being indented.
A mark or note set in the margin to call attention to something in the text, such as a change of subject.
An offset of 16 bytes in Intel memory architectures.
Equally distant from one another at all points.
definitions.example: The horizontal lines on my notebook paper are parallel.

definitions.definition: Having the same overall direction; the comparison is indicated with "to".
definitions.example: The two railway lines are parallel.

definitions.definition: (hyperbolic geometry, said of a pair of lines) Either not intersecting, or coinciding.
Involving the processing of multiple tasks at the same time.
definitions.example: a parallel algorithm

definitions.definition: A clause, phrase or word which is inserted (usually for explanation or amplification) into a passage which is already grammatically complete, and usually marked off with brackets, commas or dashes.
Either of a pair of brackets, especially round brackets, ( and ) (used to enclose parenthetical material in a text).
A digression; the use of such digressions.
Such brackets as used to clarify expressions by grouping those terms affected by a common operator, or to enclose the components of a vector or the elements of a matrix.
In the Anglican, Eastern Orthodox, Lutheran and Roman Catholic Church, an administrative part of a diocese that has its own church.
The community attending that church; the members of the parish.

An ecclesiastical society, usually not bounded by territorial limits, but composed of those persons who choose to unite under the charge of a particular priest, clergyman, or minister; also, loosely, the territory in which the members of a congregation live.
A civil subdivision of a British county, often corresponding to an earlier ecclesiastical parish.
An administrative subdivision in the U.S. state of Louisiana that is equivalent to a county in other U.S. states.
By; with.
Equal value; equality of nominal and actual value; the value expressed on the face or in the words of a certificate of value, as a bond or other commercial paper.
Equality of condition or circumstances.
(mostly uncountable) The allotted number of strokes to reach the hole.
definitions.example: He needs to make this shot for par.

definitions.definition: A hole in which a player achieves par.
An amount which is taken as an average or mean.
To reach the hole in the allotted number of strokes.
definitions.example: He will need to par every hole in order to win this game.

definitions.definition: Young salmon, at a stage between fry and smolt when they feed chiefly on invertebrates but cannot tolerate saltwater.
A young leveret.
A small open boat propelled by oars (by rowing).
A survey of opinion which is unofficial, casual, or ad hoc.
definitions.example: 2002: I don't think it was innocence that made me want to carry out a straw poll of women friends on the plausibility of this passage — James Meek in London Review of Books, Vol. 24 No. 22, 14 November 2002

definitions.definition: A length of time in which the two sides to a purchase agreement, or contract can think things over and cancel with no penalty. This period is often stipulated by national law. In the UK it is currently (2008) 14 days. In many countries it is 10 days.
The location where a person was born.
definitions.example: Portsmouth was Charles Dickens’ birthplace.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The location where something was created or devised.
definitions.example: Coney Island was the birthplace of the hot dog.

definitions.definition: An amusement park that has one or more specific central themes, often as part of its name
Endlessness, unlimitedness, absence of a beginning, end or limits to size.
A number that has an infinite numerical value that cannot be counted.
An idealised point which is said to be approached by sequences of values whose magnitudes increase without bound.

A number which is very large compared to some characteristic number. For example, in optics, an object which is much further away than the focal length of a lens is said to be "at infinity", as the distance of the image from the lens varies very little as the distance increases further.
The symbol ∞.
To provoke impatience, anger, or displeasure in.
To cause or induce displeasure or irritation.
To induce pain in (all or part of a body or organism).
To render null and void.
Experiencing a feeling of irritation.
Inflamed and painful.
A kind of fabric or blanket used in Latin America and southwestern United States.
Any of several very large pelagic rays of the genus Manta, with winglike pectoral fins, a long tail, and two fins resembling horns that project from the head.
A fruit, Ribes uva-crispa, related to the currant.
definitions.example: We had a good haul of gooseberries from our bushes this year.

definitions.definition: Any other plant or fruit in the subgenus Grossularia, distinguished from currants by bearing spines, including Ribes hirtellum, the American gooseberry.
Any of several other plants that are not closely related but bear fruit in some way similar:
(British slang) A chaperone.
An additional person who is neither necessary nor wanted in a given situation.
definitions.example: Robert and Susan were so in love with each other that nobody could go near them without feeling like a gooseberry.

definitions.definition: (British slang) A fool.
(British slang) A fantastic story; a tall tale; a hoax.
(British slang, usually in the plural) A testicle.
A vegetable.
A vegetarian.
Vegetarian; suitable for vegetarians
Vegetable-like.
An unoccupied position or job.
An available room in a hotel; guest house, etc.
Empty space.
Lack of intelligence or understanding.
A defect in a crystal caused by the absence of an atom in a lattice
A modal proposition.
A modal form, notably a modal auxiliary.
(grammar) A modal verb.
A modal window, one that cannot be closed until a decision is made.
Of, or relating to a mode or modus
(grammar) of, relating to, or describing the mood of a clause
Of, relating to, or composed in the musical modi by which an octave is divided, associated with emotional moods in Ancient — and in medieval ecclesiastical music
Of, or relating to the modality between propositions
Relating to the statistical mode.
Having separate modes in which user input has different effects.
Requiring immediate user interaction and thus presented so that it cannot be closed or interacted behind until a decision is made.
definitions.example: a modal dialog; a modal window

definitions.definition: Relating to the form of a thing rather to any of its attributes
State of being one or undivided; unity.
The product of being one or undivided.
A radical supporter of political or social revolution.
Intending to subvert, overturn or undermine a government or authority.
Any of several species of small, mostly European rodents of the family Gliridae; also called Myoxidae or Muscardinidae by some taxonomists.
Glis glis, the edible dormouse
Muscardinus avellanarius, the hazel dormouse.
A person who sleeps a great deal, or who falls asleep readily (by analogy with the sound hibernation of the dormouse).
A hinged bridge which can be raised (to prevent its being crossed, as across a moat, or to allow watercraft to travel beneath it).

A road designed for safe, high-speed operation of motor vehicles through the elimination of at-grade intersections, usually divided and having at least two lanes in each direction; a dual carriageway with no at-grade crossings, a motorway.
A toll-free highway.
Expansiveness
The formal notion of points moving away from one another under the action of an iterated function.
The exterior body of a motor vehicle.
The repair of a such body.
The application of physical therapy as a preventive measure.
A service offered that includes an erotic massage and may also include prostitution.
An official report or statement, such as a government press release or the report of a conference.
The name of the Latin-script letter E.
The base of the natural logarithm, 2.718281828459045…
A pudding of spiced, sliced apples (or other fruit), sugar and butter, baked with a crumble topping in a deep dish
A primate of the clade Hominoidea, generally larger than monkeys and distinguished from them by having no tail.
Any such primate other than a human.
An uncivilised person.
One who apes; a foolish imitator.
To behave like an ape.
To imitate or mimic, particularly to imitate poorly.
Wild; crazy.
definitions.example: He went ape when he heard the bad news.

definitions.definition: To continue to get stronger
definitions.example: The Internet continues to go from strength to strength as it matures, finding new ways to better itself.

definitions.definition: An instance of misdialling.
To dial or use a keypad incorrectly, especially on a telephone.
definitions.example: I misdialled her number and got through to a stranger.

definitions.definition: One who abstains from drinking alcohol.
Abstinent from alcohol; never drinking alcohol.
Opposed to the drinking of alcohol.
Total.
To shape in or on a mold; to form into a particular shape; to give shape to.
To guide or determine the growth or development of; influence
To fit closely by following the contours of.
To make a mold of or from (molten metal, for example) before casting.
To ornament with moldings.
To be shaped in or as if in a mold.
definitions.example: These shoes gradually molded to my feet.

definitions.definition: To cause to become moldy; to cause mold to grow upon.
To become moldy; to be covered or filled, in whole or in part, with a mold.
To cover with mold or soil.
The act or process of shaping in or on a mold, or of making molds; the art or occupation of a molder.
Anything cast in a mold, or which appears to be so, as grooved or ornamental bars of wood or metal.
A plane, or curved, narrow surface, either sunk or projecting, used for decoration by means of the lights and shades upon its surface and to conceal joints, especially between unlike materials.
(woodwork) A planing machine for making moldings.
(founding) A machine to assist in making molds for castings.
(milling) A mill for shaping timber.
(founding) A kind of sand containing clay, used in making molds.
A saw with fine teeth and a narrow blade which can cut curves in wood or metal.
A jigsaw puzzle.
To cut something using a jigsaw.
Not giving the truth; providing untrue facts; lying.
Pertaining to falsehood; corrupt; dishonest.
A murderer who slits the throats of victims.
An unscrupulous, ruthless or unethical person.
A three-player pocket billiards game where the object is to be the last player with at least one ball still on the table.
Involving the cutting of throats
Of or relating to a card game where everyone plays for him or herself rather than playing with a partner.
definitions.example: He found that playing cutthroat Spades was much more difficult than playing with a partner.

definitions.definition: Ruthlessly competitive, dog-eat-dog
definitions.example: Law is a cutthroat business, you always have to look out to see who is trying to outdo you.

definitions.definition: Any coastal area popular with tourists.
(relative to past) Having existed for so great a period of time that its longevity cannot be expressed.
definitions.example: The ageless pyramids stood prominently against the sunset.

definitions.definition: (relative to future) Continuing infinitely or indefinitely.
definitions.example: This memorial will show our ageless respect to those who died.

definitions.definition: Always appearing youthful; never seeming to age.
definitions.example: Her ageless face.

definitions.definition: One who or that which transmits something (in all senses).

An electronic device that generates and amplifies a carrier wave, modulates it with a meaningful signal derived from speech, music, TV or other sources, and broadcasts the resulting signal from an antenna.
Occurring or existing before birth
The area beside a pool.
By the side of a pool.
definitions.example: She was sunbathing on the poolside deckchair.

definitions.definition: Beside a pool.
A type of men's felt fedora; a stiff felt hat similar to a trilby.
Any of various game birds of the subfamily Tetraoninae which inhabit temperate and subarctic regions of the northern hemisphere.
To seek or shoot grouse.
A cause for complaint.
To complain or grumble.
Excellent.
definitions.example: I had a grouse day.

definitions.definition: To succeed in some task; to achieve benefit from a task or project.
definitions.example: After several barren years it was good to see the trees bearing fruit.

definitions.definition: A bed or cot for a baby, oscillating on rockers or swinging on pivots.
The place of origin, or in which anything is nurtured or protected in the earlier period of existence.
definitions.example: a cradle of crime

definitions.definition: Infancy, or very early life.
definitions.example: from the cradle to the grave

definitions.definition: An implement consisting of a broad scythe for cutting grain, with a set of long fingers parallel to the scythe, designed to receive the grain, and to lay it evenly in a swath.
A tool used in mezzotint engraving, which, by a rocking motion, raises burrs on the surface of the plate, so preparing the ground.

A framework of timbers, or iron bars, moving upon ways or rollers, used to support, lift, or carry ships or other vessels, heavy guns, etc., as up an inclined plane, or across a strip of land, or in launching a ship.
A case for a broken or dislocated limb.
A frame to keep the bedclothes from contact with the sensitive parts of an injured person.
A machine on rockers, used in washing out auriferous earth.
A suspended scaffold used in shafts.
A ribbing for vaulted ceilings and arches intended to be covered with plaster.
A basket or apparatus in which, when a line has been made fast to a wrecked ship from the shore, the people are brought off from the wreck.
definitions.example: The cradle was ill-made. One victim fell into the sea and was lost and the ensuing delay cost three more lives.

definitions.definition: A rest for the receiver of a telephone, or for certain computer hardware.
definitions.example: He slammed the handset into the cradle.

definitions.definition: (contact juggling) A hand position allowing a contact ball to be held steadily on the back of the hand.
A mechanical device for tilting and decanting a bottle of wine.
To contain in or as if in a cradle.
To rock (a baby to sleep).
To wrap protectively, to hold gently and protectively.
definitions.example: cradling the injured man’s head in her arms

definitions.definition: To lull or quieten, as if by rocking.
To nurse or train in infancy.
To rock the lacrosse stick back and forth in order to keep the ball in the head by means of centrifugal force.
To cut and lay (grain) with a cradle.
To transport a vessel by means of a cradle.
To put ribs across the back of (a picture), to prevent the panels from warping.
Holding one's own self-interest as the standard for decision making.
Having regard for oneself above others’ well-being.
Prone to treat someone badly by coarse, insulting words or other maltreatment; vituperative; reproachful; scurrilous.
definitions.example: All they could ever do was to shout abusive inanities at me and my colleagues.

definitions.definition: Tending to deceive; fraudulent.
Tending to misuse; practising or containing abuse.
Being physically or emotionally injurious; characterized by repeated violence or other abuse.
Wrongly used; perverted; misapplied; unjust; illegal.
Catachrestic.
To bring (a task, project, goal etc.) to completion; to accomplish.
To make perfect, achieve, give the finishing touch.
To make (a marriage) complete by engaging in first sexual intercourse.
definitions.example: After the reception, he escorted her to the honeymoon suite to consummate their marriage.

definitions.definition: To become perfected, receive the finishing touch.
Complete in every detail, perfect, absolute.
Highly skilled and experienced; fully qualified.
definitions.example: a consummate sergeant

definitions.definition: Boring, monotonous, time-consuming, wearisome.
Hurt or injury which interferes with the health or comfort of the victim and which is more than transient or trifling.
